coverages.coverage_name: Trip cancellation and loss of deposit

conditional_limits.condition: With 'Pre-existing medical conditions' optional cover purchased, claim due to pre-existing condition
conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 22, Pre-existing medical conditions

conditional_limits.condition: With 'Cancel for any reason' optional cover purchased, claim for reason not covered under standard benefit

limits.type: Overall limit for family plan (50% reimbursement)

conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 27, Cancel for any reason

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays for covered travel costs incurred if the entire trip is cancelled within 30 days before departure due to specified events (e.g., serious injury/illness, death of insured/companion/family member, witness duty, home damage, serious public event, specific flight cancellations, hijack >12h). Covers unused non-refundable expenses and cancellation fees.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 10, Trip cancellation and loss of deposit & Page 11, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Excludes claims if policy bought less than 72 hours before scheduled departure (unless due to accidental death). Excludes refunds/compensation received. Single trip policy ends if this benefit is paid.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 11, What is not covered & Page 12, What is not covered

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Under the 'Pre-existing medical conditions' optional cover, cancellation must be directly due to a pre-existing medical condition affecting the insured, travelling family member, or travel companion (who must also have the cover). Covers serious injury/illness making travel unfit, or death. Subject to 50% co-payment.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 22, Pre-existing medical conditions

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Under the 'Cancel for any reason' optional cover, reimburses 50% of covered travel costs for cancellation due to reasons not covered by the standard benefit. Must purchase cover within 7 days of initial trip deposit. Must seek refunds first. Policy ends if this benefit is paid.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 27, Cancel for any reason

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: General exclusion applies for events known before policy purchase or trip booking.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 31, General exclusions

conditional_limits.condition: With 'Pre-existing medical conditions' optional cover purchased, claim due to pre-existing condition
conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 22, Pre-existing medical conditions

conditional_limits.condition: With 'Cancel for any reason' optional cover purchased, claim for reason not covered under standard benefit

limits.type: Overall limit for family plan (50% reimbursement)

conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 27, Cancel for any reason

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays for covered travel costs incurred if the entire trip is postponed within 30 days before departure due to specified events (same as Trip Cancellation). Covers rebooking fees to reorganize the trip to the same destination within 180 days.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 10, Trip postponement & Page 11, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Excludes claims if policy bought less than 72 hours before scheduled departure (unless due to accidental death). Excludes refunds/compensation received. Single trip policy ends if this benefit is paid.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 11, What is not covered & Page 12, What is not covered

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Under the 'Pre-existing medical conditions' optional cover, postponement must be directly due to a pre-existing medical condition affecting the insured, travelling family member, or travel companion (who must also have the cover). Covers serious injury/illness making travel unfit, or death. Subject to 50% co-payment.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 22, Pre-existing medical conditions

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Under the 'Cancel for any reason' optional cover, reimburses 50% of covered travel costs for postponement due to reasons not covered by the standard benefit. Must purchase cover within 7 days of initial trip deposit. Must seek refunds first. Policy ends if this benefit is paid.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 27, Cancel for any reason

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: General exclusion applies for events known before policy purchase or trip booking.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 31, General exclusions

conditional_limits.condition: With 'Pre-existing medical conditions' optional cover purchased, claim due to pre-existing condition
conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 22, Pre-existing medical conditions

conditional_limits.condition: With 'Cancel for any reason' optional cover purchased, claim for reason not covered under standard benefit

limits.type: Overall limit for family plan (50% reimbursement)

conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 27, Cancel for any reason

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays if you are overseas and have to return immediately to Singapore before scheduled return due to specified events (same as Trip Cancellation, but medical confirmation must be while overseas). Covers additional administrative expenses to amend return ticket/booking OR additional transport/accommodation (economy/standard) for immediate return if original ticket cannot be amended.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 10, Trip cut short & Page 11, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Excludes cost of unused portion of original return ticket. Excludes additional expenses if no return ticket was purchased originally. Excludes costs related to buses, taxis, ride-hailing. Excludes refunds/compensation received. Excludes upgrades.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 11, What is not covered

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Under the 'Pre-existing medical conditions' optional cover, curtailment must be directly due to a pre-existing medical condition affecting the insured, travelling family member, or travel companion (who must also have the cover). Covers serious injury/illness making travel unfit, or death. Subject to 50% co-payment.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 22, Pre-existing medical conditions

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Under the 'Cancel for any reason' optional cover, reimburses 50% of covered travel costs for curtailment (after 48 hours) due to reasons not covered by the standard benefit. Must purchase cover within 7 days of initial trip deposit. Must seek refunds first.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 27, Cancel for any reason

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays if trip is cancelled before departure or disrupted during trip because a travel agent, transport provider, tour operator, or accommodation provider becomes insolvent. Covers unused non-refundable costs and additional transport/accommodation (economy/standard).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 12, Insolvency protection

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Definition of insolvency includes declared insolvency, owner under investigation for fraud/dishonesty, or owner absconding with funds. Excludes refunds/compensation received. Excludes claims if policy bought less than 72 hours before scheduled departure.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 12, Meaning of insolvency & What is not covered

base_limits.basis: S$100 for every six hours diverted while overseas

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays S$100 for every 6 continuous hours you are diverted to another destination while travelling on an airplane, before reaching your scheduled destination.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 12, Trip diversion & Page 13, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Requires written proof of delay from provider/agent showing hours and reason. Cannot claim if delay caused by insured/family/companion.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 13, What you should know & What is not covered

base_limits.basis: S$100 for every six hours delay while overseas; S$100 for the first six hours delay in Singapore only

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays S$100 for every 6 continuous hours your scheduled public transport is delayed or if you are forced to travel later due to overbooking. Limit applies before reaching scheduled destination. For delays departing Singapore, only the first 6 hours are paid.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 12, Travel delay & Page 13, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Requires written proof of delay from provider/agent showing hours and reason. Must have checked in on time. Cannot claim if delay caused by insured/family/companion.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 13, What you should know & What is not covered

base_limits.basis: S$100 for every six hours you are stranded

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays S$100 for every 6 continuous hours you are stranded if you miss a travel connection because your incoming scheduled public transport arrives late at the transit terminal, and no alternative travel is available within 6 hours.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 12, Missed connections & Page 13, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Requires written proof of delay from provider/agent showing hours and reason. Must have checked in on time for original transport. Cannot claim if delay caused by insured/family/companion.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 13, What you should know & What is not covered

conditional_limits.condition: With 'Pre-existing medical conditions' optional cover purchased, claim due to pre-existing condition
conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 23, Trip disruption

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays if trip is disrupted (in SG or overseas) forcing itinerary change due to: insured's serious injury/illness making travel unfit (confirmed by doctor); serious public event; flight cancellation due to airport/runway/airspace closure or poor weather. Covers additional transport/accommodation (economy/standard) to continue trip OR unused non-refundable costs due to itinerary change.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 13, Trip disruption & What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Excludes extending trip longer than originally scheduled. Excludes refunds/compensation received. Excludes upgrades. Excludes airline fault cancellations.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 13, What is not covered & Page 14, What you're covered for

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Under the 'Pre-existing medical conditions' optional cover, disruption must be due to serious injury/illness from a pre-existing condition making the insured unfit to travel (confirmed by doctor). Subject to 50% co-payment.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 23, Trip disruption

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Benefits provided by the policy for claims resulting directly from an act of terrorism during the trip are payable, subject to the limits and conditions for each benefit. Defines 'Act of terrorism' as acts involving force/violence for political/religious/ideological purposes to influence government or put public in fear.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 14, Terrorism cover

base_limits.basis: S$150 for every six hours of delay; S$150 for first six hour delay in Singapore only

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays S$150 for every 6 continuous hours your checked-in baggage is delayed, misdirected, or misplaced by a public transport provider, after arriving at your scheduled destination (including return to SG). For delays on return to SG, only the first 6 hours are paid.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 14, Baggage delay & What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Requires written proof from provider/agent stating name, date, time, duration, and reason for delay. Paid per claim, not per bag. Only one person paid if multiple people share baggage.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 14, What you should know

coverages.coverage_name: Theft of or damage to baggage or personal belongings

base_limits.type: Sub-limit for all other items (per item)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays if baggage or personal belongings are stolen or accidentally damaged during the trip, or lost while in the care of an airline operator. Payment based on replacement, repair, or cash amount, not exceeding original purchase price. Depreciation applies based on item age (Mobile 24m, Laptop/Electronics 36m, Other 60m, Jewellery 100% capped). Without proof, pays current market value up to S$50/item, max 5 items.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 14, Theft of or damage... & How we decide how much to pay & Page 15, How much we pay...

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Conditions: High-value items (phones, laptops, tablets, jewellery) must be carried by you (not checked-in or left unattended in vehicle). Items must be under your care or authorised person's care. Theft must be reported to police/authority within 24 hours. Benefit reduced by any amount paid under Baggage Delay for the same items.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 15, What you should know

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Exclusions: Perishables, consumables, vehicles, value cards, wear & tear, gradual deterioration, musical instruments, unauthorised phone costs, items not yours, sports equipment (covered separately), business goods, stored data, unexplained loss/mysterious disappearance.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 15, What is not covered

coverages.coverage_name: Loss of passport, travel documents & theft of money

base_limits.type: Sub-limit for theft of your money

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays for the value of stolen cash or travellers' cheques (up to sub-limit) and costs to replace lost/stolen passport or other travel documents while overseas.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 16, Loss of passport... & What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Conditions: Items must be under your care, securely locked, or in care of authorised person. Money must be stolen while carried by you (not checked-in or left unattended in vehicle). Loss/theft must be reported to police/authority within 24 hours. Call Emergency Assistance for advice on replacing documents.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 16, What you should know

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Reimburses unauthorised charges made on your credit card while overseas.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 16, Fraudulent personal credit card usage

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Conditions: Must report unauthorised charges or card theft to card issuer and police in the country where it happened within 24 hours of discovery. Must follow card issuer's rules for dealing with such charges.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 16, What you should know

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Exclusions: Charges made by family member, travel companion, or any person entrusted with card details.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 16, What is not covered

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers the excess or deductible you become legally liable to pay due to accidental loss or damage to a rental car from a licensed operator. Included in base cover for First plan.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 6, Car rental excess & Page 28, Car rental excess

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Conditions: Must be named driver/co-driver, legally allowed to drive overseas, driving at time of incident, followed rental agreement rules and local laws. Rental car must be collected overseas. Requires copy of rental agreement, receipts for excess paid, related reports. Only one claim paid per rental car across all policies.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 28, Car rental excess & What you should know

conditional_limits.condition: With 'Pre-existing medical conditions' optional cover purchased, claim due to pre-existing condition
conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 24, Emergency medical evacuation & repatriation

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers transport to move you to an appropriate medical facility (in SG or overseas) or return you to SG for continued treatment, if you suffer a life-threatening condition from unexpected illness/injury overseas. Also covers repatriation of remains if you die overseas, including reasonable mortician/undertaker costs (embalmment, cremation, basic casket/urn). Must call Emergency Assistance (+65 6322 2072) to arrange.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 17, Emergency medical evacuation & repatriation & What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: FWD decides the most appropriate medical facility and transport method. Includes administrative fees for changing travel plans if existing ticket can be used.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 17, Emergency medical evacuation & repatriation & What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Under the 'Pre-existing medical conditions' optional cover, covers evacuation/repatriation resulting from a life-threatening condition due to a pre-existing condition. Limit seems to align with base cover (Unlimited), though P24 references 'benefit limit indicated in the table of benefits' which only explicitly lists Med Expenses Overseas limit (S$150k) for this optional cover on P9. Requires call to Emergency Assistance.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 24, Emergency medical evacuation & repatriation & What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Excludes non-emergency situations.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 17, Emergency medical evacuation & repatriation

coverages.coverage_name: Personal liability while on your trip

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays if you are held legally responsible for accidental death or bodily injury to another person, or loss/damage to another person's property, while overseas. The other person must not be an interested party.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 17, Personal liability while on your trip

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays damages awarded by court (excluding punitive damages) and legal costs agreed by FWD for defence. Conditions: Do not admit liability or negotiate payment without FWD permission. FWD may take over defence. FWD must agree costs before you engage your own lawyer.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 17, What we pay & What you should know

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Exclusions: Damages from criminal proceedings; loss/damage to property in your care/custody; liability from owning/using firearms, animals, motorised vehicles, watercraft, aircraft (incl. drones), remote controlled devices, bicycles; damages connected to your trade/business/profession.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 17, What is not covered

base_limits.type: Child covered under a family plan

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays a lump sum if you suffer an accident during your trip that causes death or total and permanent disability (TPD) within 90 days. TPD means unable to work for 6 months and unlikely ever to work again. Pays according to a scale for specific injuries (e.g., loss of limbs/sight, severe burns). Maximum payout is 100% of sum insured per accident.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 18, Personal accident & Meaning of total and permanent disability & What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Severance/loss of use must be diagnosed by approved doctor and be beyond cure. If on public transport that disappears/is wrecked/sinks and body not found, considered deceased after 1 year or upon official death certificate.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 18, What you should know

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: General exclusion applies for suicide/self-inflicted acts.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 31, General exclusions

base_limits.type: Child covered under a family plan
Sub-limit for dental expenses caused by accident

conditional_limits.condition: With 'Pre-existing medical conditions' optional cover purchased, claim due to pre-existing condition
conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 24, Medical expenses incurred overseas

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Reimburses costs for medically necessary treatment received overseas due to unexpected illness or injury suffered during the trip. Covers treatment for up to 30 days from the date of first treatment.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, Medical expenses incurred overseas

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Includes: Dental treatment necessary due to accident (up to sub-limit); reasonable ambulance costs; treatment by specialist if referred by GP; mobility aids like crutches/wheelchairs (up to sub-limit, excludes prosthesis); medical equipment for recovery.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Exclusions: Dental treatment due to tooth/gum disease or normal wear; expenses for non-natural teeth (dentures, bridges, implants etc.); treatment by interested party; overseas medical treatment that was planned or pre-arranged.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, What is not covered

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Under the 'Pre-existing medical conditions' optional cover, covers medically necessary treatment overseas for illness/injury directly due to a pre-existing condition, up to the specified limit.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 24, Medical expenses incurred overseas

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: General exclusion applies for treatment sought if travelling against medical advice or for the purpose of seeking treatment.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 31, General exclusions

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays a daily benefit for each continuous 24-hour period confined to an overseas hospital due to unexpected illness or injury suffered on the trip. Admission must be medically necessary. Daily amount doubled if confined in ICU.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, Daily hospital cash while overseas & Double daily hospital cash benefit for ICU

conditional_limits.condition: With 'Pre-existing medical conditions' optional cover purchased, extension due to pre-existing condition
conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 24, Automatic policy extension

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Automatically extends the period of insurance free of charge if your return to Singapore is delayed by a serious public event, or if you are confined to an overseas hospital upon advice of a medical practitioner.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, Automatic policy extension

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Under the 'Pre-existing medical conditions' optional cover, extends free of charge if you suffer an unexpected illness/injury due to a pre-existing condition and are medically unfit to travel, or are confined to hospital overseas due to it. Doctor must confirm in writing.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 24, Automatic policy extension

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Reimburses costs of phone calls made while overseas to: FWD Emergency Assistance hotline (medical assistance/lost documents); police, medical facilities, consulates, or family members in Singapore for assistance/support due to serious illness or injury during the trip.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, Emergency phone charges

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Reimburses reasonable costs (return economy transport, standard accommodation) for one adult family member to travel to be with you, or for a travel companion to stay with you, if you suffer unexpected illness/injury overseas, are confined to hospital for at least 5 continuous days, a doctor confirms you cannot return to SG for treatment, AND you have no adult family member with you.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, Hospitalisation visit & Page 20, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Payment stops after 30 days from first confinement or when doctor confirms fit to travel/return. If insured dies while hospitalised, only one benefit (Hospitalisation Visit, Child Companion, or Compassionate Travel) is paid (the highest).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 20, What we pay & What you should know

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Reimburses reasonable costs (return economy transport, standard accommodation) for one adult family member to travel to be with you if you suffer unexpected illness/injury overseas, are confined to hospital for at least 5 continuous days, a doctor confirms you cannot return to SG for treatment, AND you are travelling with one or more children and are the only adult.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, Child companion & Page 20, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Payment stops after 30 days from first confinement or when doctor confirms fit to travel/return. If insured dies while hospitalised, only one benefit (Hospitalisation Visit, Child Companion, or Compassionate Travel) is paid (the highest).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 20, What we pay & What you should know

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Reimburses reasonable costs (return economy transport, standard accommodation) for one adult family member to travel to arrange the return of your bodily remains to Singapore or your home country if you die from an unexpected illness or injury suffered while overseas on a trip, AND there is no other adult family member on the trip.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, Compassionate travel & Page 20, Compassionate travel benefit

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: If insured dies while hospitalised, only one benefit (Hospitalisation Visit, Child Companion, or Compassionate Travel) is paid (the highest).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 20, What you should know

coverages.coverage_name: Chinese medicine practitioner, physiotherapist and chiropractor expenses

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays for treatment from Chinese medicine practitioner, physiotherapist, or chiropractor received overseas or within 48 hours of returning to Singapore, for unexpected illness or injury suffered on the trip. Capped at S$50 per visit.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 20, Chinese medicine practitioner...

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Conditions: Must have received medical treatment overseas for the same illness/injury being treated in SG, OR must seek the Chinese med/physio/chiro treatment within 48 hours of returning to SG. Excludes treatment from interested party.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 20, Treatment must be sought... & What is not covered

base_limits.type: Child covered under a family plan
Sub-limit for dental expenses caused by accident

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Reimburses costs for medically necessary treatment received in Singapore after returning from the trip, for unexpected illness or injury suffered while overseas. Treatment must be sought within 48 hours of returning to Singapore.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 20, Medical expenses incurred in Singapore

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Conditions: Must have received medical treatment overseas for the same illness/injury being treated in SG, OR must seek medical treatment in SG within 48 hours of returning. Covers treatment for up to 30 days from date of return.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 20, You can only claim this benefit if... & What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Includes: Dental treatment necessary due to accident (up to sub-limit); reasonable ambulance costs; treatment by specialist if referred by GP; mobility aids like crutches/wheelchairs (up to sub-limit, excludes prosthesis); medical equipment for recovery.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 20, The costs we will pay include the following

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Exclusions: Dental treatment due to tooth/gum disease or normal wear; expenses for non-natural teeth (dentures, bridges, implants etc.); treatment by interested party.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 20, What is not covered

coverages.coverage_name: Daily hospital cash while in Singapore

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays a daily benefit for each continuous 24-hour period confined to a hospital in Singapore as a result of an unexpected illness or injury suffered while overseas on the trip. Admission must be medically necessary and occur within 48 hours of return, OR within 30 days of return if medical treatment was sought during the trip. Daily amount doubled if confined in ICU.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 21, Daily hospital cash while in Singapore & Double daily hospital cash benefit for ICU

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Optional add-on providing coverage for specified benefits when the claim arises directly from a pre-existing medical condition. Benefits covered: Trip Cancellation/Loss of Deposit, Trip Postponement, Trip Cut Short, Trip Disruption (all with 50% co-payment and specific limits), Medical Expenses Incurred Overseas (limit S$150,000), Emergency Medical Evacuation & Repatriation (limit seems Unlimited, see specific benefit), Automatic Policy Extension (up to 30 days).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers & Page 22, Pre-existing medical conditions

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Definition: Medical condition you were aware of, or could reasonably be expected to be aware of, before the trip start; OR for which you received medical advice, tests, treatment, diagnosis, or prescription drugs during the 12 months before the trip start.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 44, Pre-existing medical condition

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Exclusions: Claims not directly arising from the pre-existing condition; claims for persons travelling with you who did not purchase the cover; terminal illness diagnosis (<12 months life expectancy) regardless of purchase; specific exclusions under each benefit type also apply (e.g., dental, Chinese med for medical expenses).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 26, For all benefits under Pre-existing medical conditions cover

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Optional add-on providing 50% reimbursement (up to specified limits) for covered travel costs if the trip is cancelled, postponed, or cut short (after 48 hours) for any reason not covered under the standard Trip Cancellation/Postponement/Cut Short benefits.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 27, Cancel for any reason

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Limits: Trip Cancellation S$6,000 (Family S$15,000); Trip Postponement S$1,000 (Family S$2,500); Trip Cut Short S$6,000 (Family S$15,000).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Conditions: Must purchase cover within 7 days of making the initial trip deposit. Must claim under only one benefit type (Cancel/Postpone/Cut Short/etc.). Must have asked for refunds from providers first (claim reduced by refund amount). Single trip policy ends if Cancellation or Postponement benefit is paid under this cover.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 27, What you should know

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Exclusions: Any amounts refunded or compensated; expenses for upgrades; extra travel/accommodation costs not in original itinerary.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 28, What is not covered

base_limits.basis: S$50 for every six hours of delay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Optional add-on. Pays S$50 for every 6 continuous hours your scheduled public transport is delayed in reaching Singapore, provided you, your family member, or travel companion were not the cause of the delay. Requires your pet to be staying in a pet hotel or kennel during the trip.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 28, Pet care & What we pay

base_limits.type: Sub-limit for rental of replacement equipment

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Optional add-on. Covers your owned sports equipment if it is stolen, accidentally damaged, or lost/stolen while in the care of an airline/transport/accommodation provider during your trip. Pays for cost of renting replacement equipment (up to S$100/day) AND compensation for the stolen/damaged equipment.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 28, Sports equipment protector & Page 29, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covered equipment: Golf clubs, diving gear, skis (boards/poles), snowboards, wakeboards, bicycles, fishing tackle equipment, specialist apparel for diving/skiing/snowboarding. Compensation based on depreciation (1yr 70%, 2yr 50%, 3yr+ 20%). Without proof: market value up to S$50/item, max 5 items.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 28, Sports equipment & Page 29, How much we pay...

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Conditions: Equipment must be under your care or secured, or in care of authorised person. Report loss/theft to police/authority within 24 hours. Excludes damage that happens while equipment is in use (practice or play).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 29, What you should know & What is not covered

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Optional add-on. Pays if your home contents are lost or damaged due to fire or burglary while you are overseas on your trip.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 30, Home contents & What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Definition: Household furniture, furnishing, domestic electronic appliances, personal belongings owned by you and in your home. Excludes cash and travellers' cheques. Compensation based on depreciation (1yr 70%, 2yr 50%, 3yr+ 20%). Without proof: market value up to S$50/item, max 5 items.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 30, Home contents definition & How much we pay...
